text:
2.8. Static vs. Dynamic 14
2.8 Static vs. Dynamic
It is possible to develop a model once and use it repeatedly to make predictions. Given that the
model is not updated or changed between forecasts, we can think of this model as being static.
Conversely, we may receive new observations prior to making a subsequent forecast that could
be used to create a new model or update the existing model. We can think of developing a new
or updated model prior to each forecasts as a dynamic problem.
